title: Protection of Communal Properties of Minorities Ordinance, 2001
title_en: Protection of Communal Properties of Minorities Ordinance, 2001
description: Official consolidated text of Protection of Communal Properties of Minorities Ordinance, 2001 (V of 2002) published by The Pakistan Code (Land/Property Laws).

provisions.title: Section 7. Power to make rules
provisions.content:
ORDINANCE, 2001
ORDINANCE NO. V OF 2002
[22nd January, 2002]
AN
to protect the properties of minority communities meant for their communal use
WHEREAS in view of prevailing circumstances, it is the demand of the minority
communities to protect their properties meant for their communal use ;
AND WHEREAS the President is satisfied that circumstances exists which render it
necessary to take immediate action ;
NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Emergency of the fourteenth
day of October, 1999, and the Provisional Constitution Order No.1 of 1999, read with the
Provisional Constitution (Amendment) Order No.9 of 1999, and in exercise of all powers
enabling him in that behalf, the President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan is pleased to make
and promulgate the following Ordinance :—

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent, commencement and application.― (1) This Ordinance may be
provisions.content:
called the Protection of Communal Properties of Minorities Ordinance, 2001.
(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.
(3) It shall come into force at once.
(4) It shall apply to properties belonging to the minority communities in Pakistan meant
for their communal use.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definition
provisions.content:
In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or
context,—
(a)    “Commission” means the National Commission for Minorities.
(b)    “Property” means places of worship, monasteries, seminaries, vicarages,
dharamshalas, gaoshalas, burial places, community centers, social welfare,
educational, health and recreational institutions meant for communal use of
minority communities and includes side buildings, vacant places, lands,
residential places or offices annexed to the said properties.

provisions.title: Section 3. Ban on sale or transfer of minority communities properties
provisions.content:
(1) No property of a
minority community meant for its communal use shall be bought, sold or transferred by any
person without NOC from the Federal Government :
Provided that nothing contained herein shall apply to a property bought, sold or
transferred for a Housing Scheme, meant for a minority community, approved by a
Provincial or Federal Government.
(2) The N.O.C. referred to in sub-section (1) may be given by the Federal Government on
the recommendation of the National Commission for Minorities.

provisions.title: Section 4. Ordinance not to apply to evacuee trust properties
provisions.content:
_ Nothing in this Ordinance
shall apply to the evacuee trust properties forming party of Trust Pool and vested in the Federal
Government under the Evacuee Trust Properties (Management and Disposal) Act, 1975 (XIII of
1975).

provisions.title: Section 5. Punishment
provisions.content:
Whoever buys, sells or transfers any property belonging to a minority
community meant for its communal use in violation of section 3, shall be punishable with
imprisonment of either description which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to
fine which shall not be less than one hundred thousand rupees and the sale or transfer transaction
shall be of no legal effect.

provisions.title: Section 6. Removal of difficulties
provisions.content:
_ If any difficulty arises in giving effect to any of the
provision of this Ordinance, the Federal Government may make such order, not inconsistent with
difficulty.
